titleStmt.title: W. T. Moore et al. to Unknown
CWG5469

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: We your petitioners from Mt Eden Ky and vicinity State. that Capt Wm Harrison Ben Houser, James Taylor, Licurgus Hudson is gentlemen of undoubted veracity and unflinching union men and Deserving executive clemency

W. T. Moore
H H Cleveland
T. R. Buckner
R. W. Young
H. C. Brown
Thomas Harrison
John McClain
George W Carpenter
William Nuton
G W McClain
B B Smith
J H Nichals
Elijah Callender
Jessie Cook
Elisha Hedden
Nathan Brown
William Pugh
Jacob Snider
Alfred Shepherd
J. C. Burnett
W. S. Crutcher
J M Harwood
J. T. McKinley
John Clarke
Thomas.J. Reid.
E L Harrison
E. W. Hedden
James B Franklin
Wm. A. Richardson
John Taylor
Hector L Haup
H. D. Clarke
W A. Rigg
